alert.note: Alert for Cobb; Douglas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:47PM EST until January 12 at 1:21AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. Sweetwater Creek near Austell affecting Douglas and Cobb Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Taylor, Talbot, Crawford and Upson Counties. Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...Alabama... Chattahoochee River at 14th Street at Columbus affecting Lee, Russell, Muscogee and Chattahoochee Counties. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Suwanee, Buford, Suwanee, Buford, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairplay, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Columbus, Union, Omaha...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Powder Springs, Powder Springs, Powder Springs, Austell, Austell, Austell, Sweetwater Creek below Austell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Flint River Basin...including Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Americus, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sweetwater Creek near Austell. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and fields upstream and downstream from the gage near the Interstate 20 bridge. Portions of a paintball playing field just downstream of the bridge and athletic fields in the Woodrow Wilson Park on Mount Vernon Road are flooded with one to two feet of water. A portion of Wren Circle in Douglas County...the County Iron Works and Sunlight Drive in Cobb County begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.8 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening.Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Wednesday was 11.8 feet. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST /900 AM CST/.
